alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 01 at 12:26PM MST until March 02 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THURSDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Periods of snow through early afternoon will become very heavy at times later this afternoon and this evening. Snowfall rates will decrease overnight, but snow showers will continue into Thursday morning. Southwest winds from 15 to 25 mph with gusts from 35 to 45 mph, will create areas of blowing and drifting snow. Winds will decrease this evening. * WHERE...Areas above 4000 feet near Doney Park, Flagstaff, Grand Canyon, North Rim, Sedona, Valle and Williams. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Additional snow forecast from noon Today to 11 AM Thursday: Doney Park 8 to 12 inches Flagstaff 11 to 17 inches Grand Canyon 5 to 9 inches North Rim 8 to 12 inches Sedona 4 to 8 inches Valle 5 to 9 inches Williams 10 to 16 inches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim
